DataElement.preferredName: Urology History Greater Than 30 Day Prior To Biopsy Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records the urological history of the subject that occurred more than 30 days prior to visit associated with biopsy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The medical specialty concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases of the genitourinary tract.

Concepts.definition: The medical specialty concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases of the genitourinary tract.

Property.preferredName: History Greater Than Integer::30 Day Prior To Biopsy
Property.preferredDefinition: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A number with no fractional part.::30:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Earlier in time or order.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The response that describes the subjects past diagnosis and treatment of diseases of the genitourinary tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating the presence of blood in the semen.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating the presence of blood in the semen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring or done each year.: An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms. 2. The process by which a patient's condition is appraised or evaluated. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Occurring or done each year.

An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms. 2. The process by which a patient's condition is appraised or evaluated. (Taber's)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The medical specialty concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases of the genitourinary tract.: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: The medical specialty concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases of the genitourinary tract.
The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the ductus deferens, or a portion of it. It is done in association with prostatectomy, or to induce infertility. (Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the vas deferens.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bacterial infectious process affecting any part of the urinary tract, most commonly the bladder and the urethra. Symptoms include urinary urgency and frequency, burning sensation during urination, lower abdominal discomfort, and cloudy urine.

Concepts.definition: A bacterial infectious process affecting any part of the urinary tract, most commonly the bladder and the urethra. Symptoms include urinary urgency and frequency, burning sensation during urination, lower abdominal discomfort, and cloudy urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Urination at short intervals; it may result from increased urine formation, decreased bladder capacity, or lower urinary tract irritation.

Concepts.definition: Urination at short intervals; it may result from increased urine formation, decreased bladder capacity, or lower urinary tract irritation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Accumulation of urine within the bladder because of the inability to urinate.

Concepts.definition: Accumulation of urine within the bladder because of the inability to urinate.
An infectious or non-infectious inflammatory process affecting the prostate gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS): A small aggregation of cells. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (in-KAHN-tih-nens) Inability to control the flow of urine from the bladder (urinary incontinence) or the escape of stool from the rectum (fecal incontinence).

Concepts.definition: Involuntary passage of stool or urine from the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.: Prostate carcinoma is one of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.  -- 2002

Concepts.definition: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

One of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Frequent episodes of urination during the night.

Concepts.definition: Frequent episodes of urination during the night.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by the persistent or recurrent inability to achieve or to maintain an erection during sexual activity.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by the persistent or recurrent inability to achieve or to maintain an erection during sexual activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Elevated; raised or increased.: Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI)

Concepts.definition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-cancerous nodular enlargement of the prostate gland.  It is characterized by the presence of epithelial cell nodules, and stromal nodules containing fibrous and smooth muscle elements.  It is the most common urologic disorder in men, causing blockage of urine flow.

Concepts.definition: A non-cancerous nodular enlargement of the prostate gland.  It is characterized by the presence of epithelial cell nodules, and stromal nodules containing fibrous and smooth muscle elements.  It is the most common urologic disorder in men, causing blockage of urine flow.

PermissibleValues.value: Decreased stream or difficulty starting stream

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: the discharge of urine.: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.

Concepts.definition: The discharge of urine.
Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Specimen Gastrointestinal Urology Laboratory Procedure Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:(GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.:The medical specialty concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases of the genitourinary tract.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
The medical specialty concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases of the genitourinary tract.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
